channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping on west corner of Kashgar and Benares road, 16th December
item.description:
Someone has dumped a load of bin bags on the corner of Kashgar and Benares Road. They are torn open and lots of rubbish is spreading.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kashgar Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge next to the bus stop, 16th December
item.description:
Could you please remove the fridge and the cable reels that are leftover both sides of the bus stop? Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is fly tipping at both ends of Maude road SE58NY, 16th December
item.description:
There is an increasing amount of fly tipping on Maude road at both ends, see photos. I also want to comment on the plastic bags used by the council to clear leaves. This makes no sense to me - its not environmentally friendly and the bags have been left along the pavements for weeks. Given that leave are biodegradable, why collect in plastic?. Please do feedback or forward to the correct department

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Maude Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Van has no valid MOT Reference - 5188079 Map link - open Google map Report history - Status: Received 16/12/2025 03:50 Van has not moved in weeks and is parked very close to this junction obscuring the view of any oncoming traffic. Van has no valid MOT

item.title: Vehicle on trailer parked for months - chained to street light, 16th December
item.description:
This trailer has been parked in Lytchet Road since before July. It has not moved. The vehicle it has on it has its plates removed but the reg plate is in windscreen. It is parked on a public highway and chained to the street lamp. The vehicle is ‘sorned’. The trailer has no number plate and not attached to a vehicle. It is a total eye sore an is illegal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
